instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3462: What is 820-3462? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.SMC_RESET_L: What is SMC_RESET_L? SMC_RESET_L puts the SMC into reset mode when it is low, _L means the signal is present when voltage is low. The SMC being in reset mode keeps it from running..
definitions.R7021: What is R7021? Current sense resistor between charger current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being drawn from the charger, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing power from the charger as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H around 4v, quarter fan spin, or battery not charging..
definitions.R7022: What is R7022? Current sense resistor between charger current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being drawn from the charger, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing power from the charger as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H around 4v, quarter fan spin, or battery not charging..
definitions.PPDCIN_G3H: What is PPDCIN_G3H? PPDCIN_G3H Is a power rail that comes directly from the laptop charger..
definitions.PPDCIN_G3H_ISOL: What is PPDCIN_G3H_ISOL? This is the voltage coming directly from the charger after going through a transistor. .
definitions.R5281: What is R5281? Pullup resistor between PP3V42_G3H and SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SCL which is a data line that allows the SMC to communicate with the battery and the battery charging chip. This line is necessary for the battery to be recognized. With red probe on ground, diode mode should measure 0.441 on pin 2 of this resistor. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
Has no liquid damage. Only previous work looks like a bios change before it arrived here. Will worry about that after board fixed.

No green light.


<SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> .42v

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> 0.400v

<SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> 3.42V

Checked around <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> and noticed pin 27 only 0.48V.

Changed <TRANSISTOR>Q7080</TRANSISTOR> a few times but no change. <RESISTOR>R7022</RESISTOR> and <RESISTOR>R7021</RESISTOR> have good values

What to check next?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
"<SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> .42v
-------------------------------
<SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> 3.42V"
Impossible!!!
Please post accurate information...

Post <TRANSISTOR>Q6910</TRANSISTOR> voltages and exact ohm resistance of <RESISTOR>R6912</RESISTOR> (measured onboard).
Check if <DIODE>D6910</DIODE> is not bad (open/short).

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
Yes <SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> is 3.42V  typo on last post.

<TRANSISTOR>Q6910</TRANSISTOR> <SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H_ISOL</SIGNAL> 18.60V <SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H</SIGNAL> 18.60V  <SIGNAL>DCIN_ISOL_GATE_R</SIGNAL>  6.78v

<RESISTOR>R6912</RESISTOR> 66.7 ohm

<DIODE>D6910</DIODE> no short

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
One of <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> output voltages wasn't correct, Replaced <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> and have light now and <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is 12.28V.

Have a 0.03 short on pin 2 of <RESISTOR>R5281</RESISTOR> so SMC is shorted.

Any ideas where a donar board can be purchased without costing $50-$60.00 US per board like on aliexpress?
